repnme.cdata!:
Bolivia - Regulatory Reform and
            Capitalization Technical Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Overall, the project outcome was rated
            satisfactory. The project was mostly devoted to supporting
            capitalization and its related legal reforms, which were
            highly satisfactory. The government's commitment, both
            in the political, and technical fields, allowed for a rapid,
            though demanding, reform program. The key lessons learned
            suggest privatization should better be preceded by the
            establishment of a legal and regulatory framework, designed
            to promote competition, and efficiency. Obviously,
            Governments tend to focus - primarily - on transactions,
            upon the divestiture of large state-owned enterprises, to
            the detriment of the accompanying legal and regulatory
            reforms. However, the Bank can emphasize these latter
            aspects through advice, and, guidance on best practices, as
            well as through the initial financing of regulatory
            agencies. The provision of technical assistance (TA) in a
            stand-alone operation, i.e., separate from an adjustment
            operation, allows maximum flexibility. As in this case, TA
            allowed for better support to preparatory efforts, as well
            as for the demonstrated commitment to satisfy an up-front
            conditionality on adjustment operations. TA projects are not
            designed to handle procurement procedures involving prior
            review; however, combining prior review thresholds with
            ex-post review mechanisms, could prove effective.

18152579.theme: Other financial and private sector development,State-owned enterprise restructuring and privatization,Regulation and competition policy,Legal institutions for a market economy
18152579.majtheme: Financial and private sector development,Rule of law

repnme.cdata!:
Bolivia - Regulatory Reform and
            Capitalization Technical Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Regulatory Reform and Capitalization
            Technical Assistance Project will provide support to: (i)
            strengthen the capacity of the Ministry of Capitalization to
            conduct the sector reform and capitalization process for six
            sectors (hydrocarbons, electricity, telecommunication,
            railway, aviation, smelter/mining); (ii) help establish the
            regulatory agency, Comision Nacional Reguladora (National
            Regulatory Commission); (iii) develop specific reform
            strategies, legislation and regulations for the
            reorganization of the telecommunications sector and the
            subsequent capitalization of Empresa Nacional de
            Telecomunicaciones (National Telecom Company); and (iv)
            develop a similar program for the aviation sector, which
            deals not only with the capitalization of Lloyd Aereo
            Boliviano (National Bolivian Airline), but also the
            divestiture of the airports authority Adminstracion Autonoma
            de Servicios Auxiliares a la Navegacion Aerea (Airports
            Administration Company), and the two smaller state-owned
            airlines Transportes Aereos Bolivianos and Transportes
            Aereos Militares.
